gov.usgs.anss.inventory

Class Item

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.inventory.Item
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TreeItem

    public class Item
extends java.lang.Object
    The item encapsulates all of the data from a database Item table row and overrides some DefaultMutableTreeNode methods so that rules of connecting items can be enforced. In particular insert so that the connection rules can be enforced at "add time".

        construct an Item from a result set on the item table
        Parameters:
        rs - A ResultSet positioned to an item row
        Throws:

      • Item

        public Item(int inID,
            java.lang.String loc,
            int pers,
            java.lang.String ag,
            java.lang.String g,
            java.sql.Date acquired,
            int equip,
            int sub,
            int locID,
            java.lang.String desc,
            java.lang.String input,
            java.lang.String op)
        Detail Constructor, match set up with one field per field in the table
        Parameters:
        inID - The item ID field
        loc - The name of the item (Serial number)
        pers - Owning person
        ag - The agency owning
        g - The "G number" on the item propert tag
        acquired - A date of purchase
        equip - The equipment type ID from the equip_type table
        sub - The sub table ID
        locID - The location of the item (ID in location table)
        desc - Optional additional text for item (but not to duplicate the equip Type
        input - Enum encoded input Power field
        op - Enum encoded operating status

      • addMaintLog

        public void addMaintLog(int maintType,
                        int maintCode,
                        java.lang.String desc,
                        java.lang.String rma,
                        int opstat,
                        java.sql.Timestamp completed)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        add a maintenance log record for this item
        Parameters:
        maintType - Maintenance type (Usually from MaintenancePanel.MAINT_?????)
        maintCode - Optional maintenance code, zero if no code associated
        desc - A text description of the transaction
        rma - Text of rma if any, set to "" if not
        opstat - The operating status after the transaction(Usually MaintenancePanel.OPSTAT_????)
        completed - The timestamp that this transaction was completed.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the link to the data base is down (usually!)

      • jamLocation

        public void jamLocation(int locID)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        move the item to a new location in the item table. Approved way to move items
        Parameters:
        locID - The location to move the item to
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the link to the inventory is down (most likely)

      • jamOperatingStatus

        public void jamOperatingStatus(int op)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        Set the operating status of the item in the item table.
        Parameters:
        op - The coded operating status (usually from MaintenancePanel.OPSTAT_??????)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Usually if the link to the database is down.

      • addLocationLog

        public void addLocationLog(java.lang.String loclogType,
                           int maintCode,
                           java.lang.String desc,
                           java.sql.Timestamp completed)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        addLocationLog - add a location log entry to the location log for this item, Note this does nothing to the Item so far. Assume the location is that of this item!
        Parameters:
        loclogType - A string describing the type of transaction to add to the log, must match the enum of this field
        maintCode - An optional maintenance code
        desc - A string describing the transaction in detail
        completed - A timestamp with the completed date for this transaction
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Usually if the link to the database is down

      • addLocationLog

        public void addLocationLog(int locID,
                           java.lang.String loclogType,
                           int maintCode,
                           java.lang.String desc,
                           java.sql.Timestamp completed)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        addLocationLog - add a location log entry to the location log for this item, Note this does nothing to the Item so far
        Parameters:
        locID - A location ID to which to apply this
        loclogType - A string describing the type of transaction to add to the log, must match the enum of this field
        maintCode - An optional maintenance code
        desc - A string describing the transaction in detail
        completed - A timestamp with the completed date for this transaction
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Usually if the link to the database is down

      • addLocationLog

        public void addLocationLog(int logType,
                           int maintCode,
                           java.lang.String desc,
                           java.sql.Timestamp completed)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        addLocationLog - add a location log entry to the location log for this item, Note this does nothing to the Item so far
        Parameters:
        logType - A int with a type in the location_log enum of the type field
        maintCode - An optional maintenance code
        desc - A string describing the transaction in detail
        completed - A timestamp with the completed date for this transaction
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Usually if the link to the database is down

      • addLocationLog

        public void addLocationLog(int locID,
                           int logType,
                           int maintCode,
                           java.lang.String desc,
                           java.sql.Timestamp completed)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        addLocationLog - add a location log entry to the location log for this item, Note this does nothing to the Item so far
        Parameters:
        locID - A location ID to which to apply this
        logType - A encode log type from the enum of the type field
        maintCode - An optional maintenance code
        desc - A string describing the transaction in detail
        completed - A timestamp with the completed date for this transaction
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Usually if the link to the database is down

        public int getTemp()
        helper for the tree which allows it to store a nodeID in the items temporarily and to override certain of the DefaultMutableTreeNode to allow us to enforce rules
        Returns:
        The int stored by the last setTemp()
